subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} â€“ a tree: branches on top, roots on the bottom (more visible in earlier forms).

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
No known cognate exists. It can perhaps be compared with Proto-{{cog|kar}} {{m|und|*mÉ™Å‹á´®||trunk (of a tree); firewood}} ({{zh-ref|Starostin}}) or Proto-Lolo-Burmese {{m|und|*Ê”muk||stump (of a tree)}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

The common Sino-Tibetan root for â€œtree; woodâ€ is {{m|sit-pro|*siÅ‹ ~ sik}}, represented by {{och-l|è–ª|firewood}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ã‘}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|æœ¨|tr=ke<sub>2</sub>}} (cf. phonetic Man'yÅgana form {{ltc-l|æ°£}}). Possibly an intermediate form. Obsolete in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}, and never found in isolation; remains in certain place names. Even in ancient times, its use was apparently limited to eastern dialects.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
